title: Dayton Aviation Heritage National Historical Park: Teacher's Guide
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Parks as Classrooms     Teacher's Guide                Teachers Guide          The Wright Brothers & Paul Laurence Dunbar  A Study of: Flying Machines, Propellers, Catapults, and Printing Process  "We were lucky enough to grow up in an environment where there was always much encouragement to children to pursue intellectual interests;to investigate whatever aroused curiosity. In a different kind of environment, our curiosity might have been nipped long before it could have borne fruit." - Orville Wright, 1943   Here you will find the full and complete Teachers Guide that contains all of the lesson plans and appendices for this Teachers Guide.  To browse and download individual lesson plans, please visit the Curriculum Materials page which allows you to search or scroll through the entire library of lesson plans.  A separate file containing the Table of Contents for the guide is also available for download below so that you can browse the lesson plans available in the Teachers Guide and choose which individual plans you would like to download. This Teachers Guide was developed and written by Tim Carey, Linda Freeman, Jeanette McNally, and Mary Webb. Complete Teachers Guide - PDF File (3 MB) Table of Contents - PDF File (109 kb)
